title-group.article-title: A NEW APPROACH TO RICHARDSON EXTRAPOLATION IN THE FINITE ELEMENT METHOD FOR SECOND ORDER ELLIPTIC PROBLEMS

abstract.p: This paper presents a nonstandard local approach to Richardson extrapolation, when it is used to increase the accuracy of the standard finite element approximation of solutions of second order elliptic boundary value problems in ℝ N , N ≥ 2. The main feature of the approach is that it does not rely on a traditional asymptotic error expansion, but rather depends on a more easily proved weaker a priori estimate, derived in [19], called an asymptotic error expansion inequality. In order to use this inequality to verify that the Richardson procedure works at a point, we require a local condition which links the different subspaces used for extrapolation. Roughly speaking, this condition says that the subspaces are similar about a point, i. e., any one of them can be made to locally coincide with another by a simple scaling of the independent variable about that point. Examples of finite element subspaces that occur in practice and satisfy this condition are given.
